image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission has found the man who led the Board of Inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann engaged in "serious corrupt conduct".

title.children: 'Serious corrupt conduct': Findings from inquiry into Walter Sofronoff released

image.altText: A concrete sign that reads "Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: A court battle between the former head of the ACT's education directorate and the ACT's corruption watchdog ends with the ACT Supreme Court ordering no costs for either side.

title.children: No costs awarded in former education boss's legal battle with corruption watchdog

image.altText: A young man with brown hair stands in front of a white wall with some scaffolding attached, holding plans for a deck

props.synopsis: Construction workers are calling on the ACT government to speed up the approval process for development applications amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Waiting months for approval for a deck, tradies say change is needed

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man who pleaded guilty to trafficking drugs denies he had anything to do with the importation of a parcel containing methamphetamines, mailed from California to an address in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra man guilty of drug trafficking denies US importation involvement

image.altText: Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies celebrate a try

props.synopsis: Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies escape with fines for their brawl inside an elevator during the NRL's Las Vegas jaunt.

title.children: Raiders duo avoid suspensions over Las Vegas brawl

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A former childcare provider with over 30 years experience in the sector says the ACT's childcare regulator lacks teeth, with a recent report showing the territory has the second highest rate of serious incidents in the sector.

title.children: ACT childcare centres record second highest rate of 'serious incidents'

image.altText: A black and white cat sits on a fence post in front of rolling hills

props.synopsis: For thousands of years farmers have kept cats for their talents at catching rats and mice, and now there are calls for people working the land to be able to claim tax deductions their health and upkeep,

title.children: Working dogs are famous but what about working cats?

image.altText: Jacinta Klein

props.synopsis: About 100 undergraduate and Masters teaching students in the ACT are in classrooms without supervision, in a program designed to help with the chronic teacher shortage. But does putting them in the classrooms earlier lead to burn out faster?

title.children: 'There was something missing': The students already teaching

image.altText: A copy of Tolstoy's War and Peace with the middle cut out of the pages, where a camera is hidden.

props.synopsis: Intelligence agencies, politicians and spies offer support for a proposed National Spy Museum in Canberra, which would portray the nation's history of espionage and pay tribute to those who have spied.

title.children: 'Everybody loves a spy story': National Spy Museum proposed for Canberra

image.altText: A middle aged woman with brown hair sitting at a table with a small dog

props.synopsis: As data shows thousands of over-65s are winding up in hospital with oral health issues, the Australian Dental Association is calling for a scheme that gives seniors access to free dental work.

title.children: Dentists want a free oral health plan for seniors as hospitalisations surge

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu in front of an Israeli flag

props.synopsis: These attacks in Gaza come just hours before large protests against the Netanyahu government were due to begin.

title.children: For weeks, there have been signs that Gaza's ceasefire might not hold

image.altText: A young Palestinian man inspecting a bombed out room with buildings visible behind him.

props.synopsis: While the US has stated it supports Israel's next steps, European and Middle Eastern governments are warning the renewed strikes risk undermining regional stability.

title.children: 'Dangerous escalation': World leaders react to Israeli strikes on Gaza

image.altText: Aerial shot of big gas plant on the red rocks of the Burrup in the Pilbara

props.synopsis: The opposition leader would move to facilitate approval for the WA gas expansion within 30 days, and crack down on appeals against approval decisions.

title.children: Dutton vows fast-track approval for Woodside's gas behemoth

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The state government is being urged to fast-track pokies carded play, used at Crown Casino, to all of Victoria's poker machine venues.

title.children: A trial to curb pokies losses is set to roll out in Victoria — not everyone's happy

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt and black sunglasses kneels down in red sand

props.synopsis: The discovery of these skeletal remains rewrote Australia's history books. Decades later, they're at the centre of a court battle.

title.children: Reburials underway amid court challenge over thousands-year-old skeletons

image.altText: Jase Shore in a green cap and white shirt with neck tattoos

props.synopsis: After hearing "anguished" yells from members of the public in Sydney's CBD in 2019, these men raced to apprehend a man on a stabbing rampage.

title.children: Heroes who pinned Sydney murderer with milk crate given bravery award

image.altText: Paul Tilbury is wearing a suit but no tie

props.synopsis: Over two years, disability support provider Paul Kevan Tilbury falsely claimed more than $400,000 from the NDIS and used the cash to buy meals, jewellery, alcohol, tobacco and to install a home bar.

title.children: 'Shameful' NDIS provider jailed for fraudulently claiming $400,000

image.altText: A toddler reaching for a milk feeding bottle.

props.synopsis: An Australian study has found that bottle feeding toddlers to help get them to sleep is linked to dental cavities and overweight in early childhood. But there are other strategies that can help settle them.

title.children: Bottle feeding toddlers to sleep linked to health risks, study finds

image.altText: Cadbury factory in Claremont, Hobart

props.synopsis: A growing "effluent plume" near Hobart's Museum of Old and New Art (Mona) was far from ideal a week before Christmas. Emails and reports show how the environmental emergency at a nearby Cadbury factory developed.

title.children: How Cadbury factory caused a 'muddy water' environmental emergency

image.altText: Woman and man smiling in a selfie in front of the ocean.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright was camping at one of Victoria's most popular national parks when he was bitten by a tiger snake. More than two months later he hasn't fully recovered.

title.children: Within minutes of being bitten by a snake, Matt was struggling to breathe

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A damaged plane with black marks after flames.

props.synopsis: A fire that destroyed a South Korean plane prompts closer examination of lithium-ion battery safety, with some airlines starting to change their rules.

title.children: South Korea plane fire likely caused by battery pack, now airlines changing rules

image.altText: Friedrich Merz giving a speech in the Bundestag, the German parliament.

props.synopsis: The colossal spending package for defence and infrastructure comes amid concerns about the extent of US support for European security.

title.children: German MPs back fiscal 'bazooka' to boost defence spending

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: The 41-year-old Victorian man is charged with allegedly making death threats and antisemitic comments to a federal MP.

title.children: Man charged over alleged death threats, antisemitic abuse against federal MP

image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: Indexation changes kick in today, meaning several welfare payments will go up by several dollars.

title.children: Centrelink and other payments will change tomorrow to address inflation

image.altText: A child playing with magnetic plastic shapes on a surface. The child's face can't be seen.

props.synopsis: With centres reassessed on average every four years, and some gaming the system, parents cannot be sure their child's centre meets the standards or that staff are properly trained or qualified.

title.children: Australia's childcare rating system labelled 'a joke' as failing centres stay open for years

image.altText: A map with a heavily redacted black box

props.synopsis: The state government has identified five parcels of land for logging, but redacted their location. It has left some Tasmanians "shocked that in 2025 that we're actually having to fight for our native forests".

title.children: Nearly 10,000ha undisclosed forest set for logging, sleuthing shows us where

image.altText: A photo showing a close up of man's face from the side.

props.synopsis: The NT government has officially terminated Michael Murphy's contract as police commissioner, almost two weeks after he revealed himself as the subject of an ICAC investigation.

title.children: NT police commissioner officially sacked by government after ICAC scandal

image.altText: Prince Harry at a conference in a suit

props.synopsis: A federal judge ordered the release of Harry's visa records, which could reveal if he disclosed prior drug use before he came to the US.

title.children: Prince Harry's US visa record is being made public. Here's what we know

image.altText: An aerial view of coal extracted from the Narrabri mine, with a landscape of lakes and mountains behind it.

props.synopsis: Three of Australia's coal powerhouses have challenged a Fair Work Commission ruling forcing them to engage in multi-employer bargaining in a case that could affect thousands of workers.

title.children: Mine argues NSW town 'not a nice place to live' in landmark court case

image.altText: People with LGBTQIA+ rainbow flags walk past a limestone building

props.synopsis: Hungarian politicians pass new legislation that bans Pride events and introduces hefty fines for anyone at a prohibited event.

title.children: Hungary passes law banning Pride events in new assault on LGBTQIA+ rights

image.altText: A person uses an autopen to sign a document

props.synopsis: US presidents have been using autopens for decades, but now Donald Trump says Joe Biden's January 6 committee pardons are invalid because they were signed using the device. But what even is an autopen?

title.children: What is an 'autopen' and do Trump's claims about Biden's use of it stack up?

image.altText: Man holds rock with fossil fish.

props.synopsis: The serendipitous discovery of an exquisitely preserved fossil near Gulgong in NSW provides a glimpse into the evolution of Australian fish around 15 million years ago when the area was a tropical lake.

title.children: Fish fossil discovered in NSW is so well-preserved we can see its lunch

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has doubled down on his proposal to hold a referendum to change the constitution to allow citizenship to be stripped from dual nationals who break the law.

title.children: Former attorney-general rubbishes Dutton's 'very bad' referendum idea

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: A new report from campaign group Everybody's Home finds that Australian renters now need to earn at least $130,000 a year to comfortably afford the national weekly asking rent for a typical unit.

title.children: Even on a $100,000 salary, Australians struggle to afford average rent
